name: Modern Home Near Campus & Downtown
description:
Great house on the south side of town, near campus. 15 minute drive to airport. 15 minute walk to down town. Sunny porch with grill and fenced in yard.
3 queen size bedrooms with lots of light and 2 full bathrooms. Large kitchen, great for entertaining. Kitchen is equipped with all the basics, but please inquire about specifics.
neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood, close to parks, campus, great restaurants and bars! Quiet, yet centrally located. If you're planning on staying in town there is no need to rent a car.
host_about:
We have been traveling with Airbnb for the past 6 years and have been hosts ourselves for the past 4. We love the experience of staying in a home and getting familiar with a neighborhood when we travel and we are happy to pass that experience along to our guests. 
We reside in Livingston, Montana where we spend our free time floating the rivers, fishing and camping in the summers and skiing at nearby Bridger Bowl in the winter. 
We prefer our privacy and independence when we travel but are always open to local tips and suggestions and we are happy to give you the same when you come to Montana.
We are both local business owners who have a combined 30+ years in the area. We are more than happy to share any knowledge of the area that we have with you. Please ask!

name: The Montana Mountain Villa
description:
Our 1920's home sleeps 9+ has 5 bedrooms, 3 shower/baths, 5 toilets, 2 wood-burning fireplaces, 2 dining areas, a family/TV room, Sonos, an outdoor hot tub, 2 outdoor dining areas & an outdoor fireplace & 2 BBQ's, 2 front-loading washer/dryers & a 2-car heated garage.

We ALSO have a separate entrance Loft which MIGHT be available to rent as well. Ask if interested. It sleeps 3+ & has a full kitchen & bath, TV area & a fun indoor swing. For details see: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/4008507
neighborhood_overview: We are just a few blocks from MSU to our south, and to Southside park to our north. In the summer you can play tennis or pickle ball in the park and in the winter, it all becomes an ice skating rink. To get downtown you can ride our bikes and be there in just a few minutes or take a walk through the historic district and get to main street in 15 or so minutes.
host_about:
We moved to Bozeman, Montana from Sonoma County in 2000 with a little kid, two dogs & a cat. The following decades were largely spent renovating this old 1920's home, while juggling all things young families juggle. Thankfully, things are finally slowing down.

Before joining AirBnB, we hosted international students and non-profit workers in "The Loft" - our  private entry guest space  - but have found hosting on AirBnB to be a great experience!

name: Modern Loft-House: Big Sky Country
description: House has been fully renovated, adorned with new furnishings, and features a spacious open floor plan.  Enjoy 2 Master suites and 2 additional bedrooms.  You will enjoy luxurious linens, towels and all of the extras that make it a home away from home
neighborhood_overview:
Whether you are an outdoor enthusiast, enjoy strolling the historic street of downtown Bozeman or visiting the Gallatin Valley on business - this is your home away from home. You will be within walking distance to the thriving downtown area with many restaurants, coffee shops, salons, boutiques, cultural venues, Montana State University,and the world famous Museum of the Rockies. There are miles of hiking, biking, and cross country trails located just blocks away. Recreation begins with the breathtaking views of the Bridger Mountains and Hyalite Recreation Area that are displayed out of the dinning and living room windows. Burke Park, 40 acres of non fenced beauty where endless miles of trails weave through, is right around the corner. This area features Peet's Hill which is a great place to close the day out watching the sunset with views of Bozeman. Single track trails continue across Highland Blvd and follow Kagy Road to ‘Painted Hills Trail’.
Within minutes from this

name: Bozeman Getaway in Ideal Location
description: Large townhouse in ideal location.  Less than 2 miles to historic downtown Bozeman.  Ride your bike to restaurants or shops.  Located in quiet golf course community, on the road to Bridger Bowl ski resort.   Mountain views; surrounded by wooded trails.  Walk to xc skiing/hiking trails, golf, "Bozeman Beach", Story Mill Community Park and MAP brewing.  Private deck.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in a golf course community which turns into xc ski trails in the winter.  We are surrounded by open space and within walking distance to the new 60 acre Story Mill Park.
host_about: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair. —Khalil Gibran

name: Happy, Healthy, Home in the Heart of Downtown BZN!
description:
We have over 186 five star reviews on VRBO as well as those you see here on Airbnb!
Bring your friends and family to this unique artsy home. Located in Bozeman's hip North East Neighborhood. Fully designed & remodeled with an artist's eye. Minutes walk to the heart of Main street. Enjoy luxurious sleep on our new organic hybrid mattresses & super soft 100% bamboo sheets! We prioritize health so that your can get out and fill your days with adventure and then sink into comfort!
neighborhood_overview: Our home is an easy stroll to tasty restaurants and shops. One block away is the main road to Bridger Bowl Ski Area. You are within walking distance to a shuttle service to the ski area & the Main Stream Bus Stop! Also an easy walk, you will find Bikram Yoga to warm you up and the Loft Spa which offers a sauna, steam room and cold plunge. There are many opportunities for scenic walks. Pete's hill is very close where you can take your dog and watch the sunset over Bozeman. Yellowstone National Park is an hour and a half drive through either the breathtaking Paradise River Valley or the Gallatin River Valley. Drive the Loop and take in the amazing wildlife of Montana. On your way, be sure to soak in the Historic Chico Hot Springs and Bozeman Hot Springs while you are here!
host_about: I am a health coach and energy medicine practitioner and my husband a contractor. We own a successful vacation rental in downtown Bozeman. We love accommodating travelers and seek out similar experiences when we travel.

description: On Main Street in downtown Bozeman this beautiful, spacious new condo with private heated garage overlooks Lindley Park and is walking distance to restaurants/shops and right in the heart of it all - MSU, Yellowstone and ski country (Big Sky and Bridger).  Lost SuperHost status Jan 2024 due to missing stay target by one stay due to demand of condo and limited availability.
neighborhood_overview: Our condo is located overlooking Lindley Park on E. Main Street.  We love it because we are walking distance to all the shops, restaurants, The Ellen and more, but we just escape the noise that all accompanies all that fun.
host_about: We have five amazing kids were expats from the day they were born!  We love using Airb&b for our travels and hosting guests in our holiday home in the US.

name: Historic University District Home, #STR22-00063
description: Clean, bright, sunny, historic home with original wood work in living area.  Private, fenced backyard with grill, firepit, trampoline, sandbox with toys. Bikes available upon request. Playroom with toys.  Perfect for families or small groups.  King bed in the master, queen bed in the downstairs bedroom and a trundle bed in other bedroom.  Office/studio off master.  4 blocks from MSU and close to downtown.
neighborhood_overview: Cooper Park is 1/4 block away.  Walk to restuarants, stores and coffee shops near MSU. Walk to events at MSU.  Main Street is 5 blocks away.  Southside Park has a playground and is 4 blocks away.  Irving School is one block away and has a playground that is accessible on the weekends.
host_about: I am Dad to 2 great kids, a Trail runner, business owner and traveler.  I am CEO of a landscaping business in Bozeman.  I have traveled extensively in Europe and Asia. I enjoy reading, learning languages and cultures and seeing new things.  I enjoy traveling off the beaten path.

name: Treasure State Hostel 6 Bed Dorm
description: We are a safe, clean, and affordable hostel located in the middle of Main Street in downtown Bozeman. A short walk to all the popular shops, galleries, restaurants, and nightlife, we are the perfect spot for guests to enjoy all Bozeman has to offer. For outdoor enthusiasts, Yellowstone National Park is an hour and a half away, and Bridger Bowl (20 minutes) and Big Sky resort (an hour) are nearby options for skiers and snowboarders. Montana State University is only 1.5 miles away.
neighborhood_overview: There is no question the pulse of Bozeman lies in the Downtown area. The center of this is Main Street, and Treasure State Hostel is located in the heart of it. With several restaurants, bars, pubs, galleries, boutiques, and shops surrounding our hostel, culture and soul are impossible to miss when exploring just outside our walls. You'll be connected to all the important parts of what makes Bozeman incredible when staying with us!

name: Bridger guesthouse, 1/2 way between MSU/Downtown!
description:
This spacious 3 bed apartment is in an ideal Bozeman location. It is about a mile walk north to downtown, a mile walk west to MSU, a mile walk to the south lies the Museum of the Rockies, and a mile to the east on top of Peet's Hill in Burke Park.

Enjoy a home away from home, during your visit to Bozeman, at Bridger Guest House.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quintessential college town neighborhood, but boasts great access to the city trail system and nearby parks. Christie fields, Bogert Park, Lindley Park, Burke Park/Peet's Hill, and the Gallagator Linear Trail system are all very close. There are MANY small independent coffee shops/breweries/eateries within walking distance, and of course, the campus of MSU and downtown are about a mile away.

If you are a student, or family of a student, looking to check out the campus for MSU Fridays, or just whenever, let Mike know, as he is a graduate of the Microbiology program, and can fill you in. This may be the best neighborhood for college kids in town, as it is quieter, has amazing access to the town and its amenities, and sits in the middle of much of the downtown parklands.
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

name: Country Living in the City
description:
Our lovely home has been described as "Country living in the city" and, as such, the location cannot be beat. Our quiet street provides a nice setting for relaxation and splendid views of the surrounding area. We are an easy walk or drive to MSU or downtown (1/2 mile to Main St.).

You’ll love this home because of the ambiance, views, the neighborhood, the light, and the comfy beds. The furniture and beds are all new. The house water comes from our own well providing fresh, crystal clear water.
neighborhood_overview: Our quiet street is shared by only five other houses and the neighbors are great.
host_about: Sheryl and I have lived here for the last 30 years. We've both lived all over the country but now we call Bozeman home. The kids have grown so we decided to simplify/downsize and offer the house for vacationers. We love Bozeman and hope you do as well!

name: Luxury Condo In Downtown Bozeman on Main Street
description: Our luxurious condo is on Main Street in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, right next to Lindley Park. Facing south, we often have beautiful sunlight streaming in through our windows. Walk anywhere downtown within minutes. Ale Works and the Cider House are a couple of blocks away. It's sixteen miles to skiing at the Bridgers. We're just off the highway if you're heading Yellowstone or coming from the airport. Or  you can just relax right here, in our spacious place, away from the hubbub on Main.

host_about: I was born and raised in the Caribbean and went to school in England.   I lived on the East Coast for many years and moved to Bozeman Montana in 2003.   I have raised my 3 kids here and they have all attended Montana State University.

name: Cabin On Montana: Clean 3-bedroom 2-bath home
description: The Cabin On Montana offers guests a quiet comfortable place to stay while visiting beautiful Bozeman, Montana. The cabin was fully renovated in the summer and fall of 2016. It is well adorned with new mattresses, furniture, and appliances. The cabin is well situated with quick access to Bridger Bowl and other highlights in the area. It is a short walk or bike to the center of downtown or one of Bozeman's many breweries or restaurants.
neighborhood_overview: The Cabin On Montana is located in a residential neighborhood seven blocks north of downtown.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: "Elegant Escape" (KING BED) Great Location!
description:
Come enjoy all that Bozeman has to offer in your home-away-from-home.
Relax and unwind in our sparkly clean, and very comfortable Bozeman escape!
Conveniently located to all of Bozeman's hot spots.
FYI- Cleaning fee $225 combined w/ $45 damage fee.
neighborhood_overview: This cozy retreat is "conveniently" located in a family friendly neighborhood steps from a playground, park, and walking trails. Four groceries, a fish market, banks, gas stations, and the Gallatin Valley Mall are all within a short bike ride or up to a five-minute drive, as well as a ten minute drive to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Welcome to Madison Guest House!
description: With 3 beds and 1 bath, and 2 outdoor spaces, in roughly 900 sq ft, the home is a welcome respite from the road, or plane! The home has wifi, full laundry/bath/and kitchen and 2 off street parking spots.
neighborhood_overview:
If we are full during your trip, check out our other listings:
-Exact floor plan and location with larger yard? Bridger Guest house may be open as well.

Our guest homes are located in University Subdivision, and tucked behind the Gallagator Trail on Bozeman's south side. Our neighborhood is located very close to 5 large municipal parks.

Bozeman Public Library / Lindley Park / Peet's Hill area just south of Main St. is a great family walk after a night enjoying the Downtown bars and restaurants.

To the west and south west, is Montana State University, and is a few minutes away by bike or walk. Enjoy football games, Museum of the Rockies, graduations, move-in/outs, and do some research and stay with us!
host_about:
We are a family of four who live in Bozeman, MT. We met doing seasonal work in Yellowstone in 2004, and that was only the start of our ongoing adventure, which now includes two little girls.

We pride ourselves in knowing all of the secret spots in the surrounding Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem. We have an informative guidebook which can be useful when planning your adventures. It includes information about all manners of trips in the surrounding dozen different mountain ranges: hiking, mountaineering, rock climbing, whitewater rafting, caving,  skiing/snowboarding/Xcountry, fishing, boating/rafting, horseback riding, large animal and bird spotting, and much more. We also offer up an up to date city guide with ideas on what to do in or awesome town in between trips into the wilderness.

We are a young outdoorsy couple with a lot of travel experience, mostly in the big empty lands of our world. We are open to all types of people, whether young, old, LGBT, religious/athiest, brown, white, yellow, pink, or purple.

name: Spacious 3bed/2bath Bozeman home
description:
*NOTE: Our home is only available for reservations of 30 nights or more.*

Welcome to our spacious 3b/2b single-story home, nestled in a quiet neighborhood among beautiful Big Sky Country. With a wealth of nearby parks, easy access to Bozeman's historic downtown with its local shopping and trendy restaurants, let our home be the basecamp for your unforgettable adventure. The light, airy layout makes for an easy departure from the clutter and chaos of the real world.
neighborhood_overview:
Surrounded and immersed in all the natural beauty Big Sky Country as to offer, Bozeman retains it's historic roots while embodying the thriving spirit of a college town. Do you long for hiking trails minutes from your door? Camping opportunities? The driving range? The slopes? Would you love to learn about the natural history of the American frontier but also want to experience some great eats and a thriving nightlife? Bozeman offers all that, and more!

Not all your plans have to be so ambitious. Parks both sprawling and hidden are scattered around the city, meaning you're never far from the varied Montana wildlife. Take a ten minute walk north from the house and you'll reach the Gallatin County Regional Park; a little further East and you can play a round of frisbee golf in Rose Park.

Other daytime activities include boutique shopping downtown and museum hopping, including the Museum of the Rockies, which houses the largest T-rex skull in the world.

Ou
host_about: We love to travel, and during our adventures in Europe, Costa Rica, and the Caribbean Islands, we've noticed that it's the little things that make all the itinerary planning and redeye flights worth it. Originally from California, we've fallen in love with the wilds of Montana and Wyoming, and plan to start a family in Bozeman one day. In the spirit of family, we'd love to invite you into our home, so that you can experience all the magic we felt when first exploring this exciting, crazy, beautiful land.

name: Black Bear Inn: A comfy cozy 2 bedroom 1 bath unit
description: This is a beautiful native American inspired decorated  space. Private view looking out at the Bridger mountains! Peaceful and quiet, play bocci ball, badminton or corn hole  in backyard.   Home is cool all summer. We are within walking distance of the Cherry river fishing access and Bozeman beach.. We are a minute from town but secluded enough to feel like the country. A birders paradise. Close to Hot springs ! Awesome
neighborhood_overview: This is a secluded private country place , but on the edge of town and close to everything. It is a birders paradise being a flight path to the cherry creek ponds at the end of the road. While secluded we do have neighbors, although not visible. We ask that there are no loud parties.Fun and noise are fine just nothing over the top past 11 pm. And no fireworks .
host_about: I'm a happy go lucky host that can visit if you wish or give you privacy at the same time. I'm always happy to meet new people and give them a homey comfortable eclectic experience.

name: The Cottage Downtown
description:
Ditch hotels, travel like a local!
Expect more value for your dollar than a hotel. Here you will be able to save money cooking your own meals, sleep in separate rooms if you are a big group, wash your laundry, and enjoy Bozeman as if you lived here!
We are a family and this is a house. We are not a hotel chain. Please do not expect hospital corners on the bedsheets but expect clean linens and a tidy house.
Thanks for checking out The Cottage! Enjoy your stay!

name: Quilt Cottage
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's Northeast Neighborhood is known to be the most colorful part of town, with more mixed use, artists and shops, and increasingly home to quality food, coffee roaster, bakery, and breweries. It has great access to downtown as well, and trails that start here and branch off all over town and the surrounding area.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: The Bungalow Downtown
description:
This 1912 craftsman home is in the heart of old Bozeman! Two turns off the interstate takes you to the front door and downtown is only a few blocks away! Vaulted ceilings, wood floors, and everything you need to enjoy your stay!
Caution: The floors of this house creek. You can hear guests above walking.
FAQ: the stairway dead-ends at the top.

We are dog friendly with a $10/dog pet fee. Please get approval if brining more than 2 dogs. Cats are not allowed without prior approval

name: Dahlia House
description: Sustainable super-insulated home with solar electricity and electric car charger! Free, fast WiFi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in.
neighborhood_overview: North Church Ave is the widest street in the northeast side as the trolley used to run up it. It also is bordered by two through streets so has much less traffic. There is an elementary school on the next block towards Main St with a house and an old church in between. It's a coveted residential area all the streets in the area have been totally redone so there are no major road closures during the summer which are common around town.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: 'Bozeman Getaway' w/ Mountain Views, Near Downtown
description: 'Bozeman Getaway' invites you to explore the Northern Rocky Mountains and quaint local attractions for your next adventure! This 4-bedroom, 3.5-bath vacation rental condo was built in 2005 and has since been meticulously maintained, with accommodations for guests on a quick retreat or extended stay. Walk to local restaurants and Bozeman's largest fitness center, enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and more in the nearby Bridger Mountains, or take a day trip to visit Yellowstone Park!
neighborhood_overview:
ADVENTURE TRAILS: Leverich Canyon Mountain Trail Head (4 miles), Drinking Horse Mountain Trailhead (8 miles), Sypes Canyon Trailhead (9 miles), Middle Cottonwood Trail (11 miles), Moser Creek Trailhead (12 miles)
REEL IT IN: All Water Anglers (2 miles), Montana Angling Company (3 miles), Campbell's Guided Fishing Trips (3 miles), Montana Angler (3 miles), Cherry River Fishing Access (3 miles)
OUTDOOR FUN: Gallatin County Regional Park (2 miles), Bogert Park (3 miles), Lindley Park Center (3 miles), Painted Trails Access (6 miles)
CULTURAL VIBES: Bozeman Art Museum (2 miles), Montana Science Center (2 miles), American Computer & Robotics Museum (3 miles), Gallatin History Museum (3 miles), Museum of the Rockies (4 miles)
HITTIN' THE SLOPES: Round House Ski and Sports Center (2 miles), Bridger Bowl Ski Area (19 miles), Crosscut Mountain Sports Center (20 miles), Big Sky Resort (48 miles)
AIRPORT: Yellowstone International Airport (9 miles)

description:
This spacious townhome was designed with you in mind!
We fashioned this home with many added comforts for a memorable vacation getaway.
Come relax and unwind in our cozy Bozone Bliss!
FYI- Our cleaning fee is $225 combined w/ $45 damage fee.
neighborhood_overview: This cozy retreat is "conveniently" located in a family friendly and "award winning Valley West" neighborhood steps from a playground, park, small lake, and walking trails. Four groceries, a fish market, banks, gas stations, and the Gallatin Valley Mall are all within a short bike ride or up to a five-minute drive, as well as a ten minute drive to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Greetings!  
We are Jason and Celeste Lovelace.  We have been married 25 adventurous years and can't wait for 25 more!!  We moved to Bozeman Mt. 16 years ago from Seattle Washington and even though we love the Pacific Northwest, Bozeman has become home to us.  We feel very blessed to raise our  three children in this family-friendly community.  We own a painting company, and we are involved in real estate investing. We love to travel when time permits and hope to visit many vacation rentals in the future!

name: Cozy, Clean & Great location w/Mountain Views
description: Single level, clean, cozy, modern. 15 min. from airport. Full Kitchen, DW, and well appointed. neighborhood_overview:
Townhome in a quiet, convenient location on the west side of Bozeman. Surrounded by several city parks and trails.

3.5 miles from downtown Bozeman, a thriving Main Street filled with great shopping, galleries, bars and restaurants.

20 miles from Bridger Bowl
15 miles from Hyalite canyon
6 miles to Bozeman Hot Springs
3.5 miles to Montana State University

3 miles to I-90
45 miles to Big Sky
90 miles to Yellowstone National Park
host_about: Hi there! I've lived in Bozeman since 1987. I absolutely love Montana and love sharing it. I work hard here in order to play and stay here. I believe that Montana has a special energy and have thought that ever since I first visited, the people and the land. Big Sky country, the Last Best Place, all true descriptions, stunningly beautiful, you can see for miles and although we have longer winters here than some, the sun shines more here than any other place I have lived.

name: The Westside Nest - Cozy & Convenient!
description: This quaint little townhome is just minutes from shopping, restaurants, grocery stores, parks, MSU campus, hiking trails, downtown and more! Guests can easily access main roads or hop on the Streamline Bus, making visiting local hot spots a breeze. Take a day trip to soak in the nearby hotsprings, explore the caverns, visit Yellowstone, or simply experience the beautiful town of Bozeman, and return home to enjoy all the amenities this cozy home has to offer. Come relax at The Westside Nest!
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a mix of families and young professionals. It's very quiet and laid back. Just down the street is a little park with swings, a jungle gym, basketball court, etc. It's a small neighborhood that seems to be growing every year. A short drive in the other direction are restaurants, the mall, movie theater, grocery store, campus and downtown. The location is very convenient when checking out what Bozeman has to offer!
host_about: Tess is my name and dancing is my game! I'm a Minnesota transplant who found her way to Montana for school and have stayed in the mountains ever since. When traveling, I'm either flanked by my fantastic husband, a group of amazing girlfriends or a handful of crazy family members. I like to relax, check out nightlife, shop and explore fun hot spots when I visit new places. Point me towards the best burger joint in town where I can enjoy live music and a local brew, and I'm a happy camper!

name: LazyDog Midtown Retreat
description:
Our home provides a comfortable, spacious jumping off point to enjoy the best of Bozeman. You will have the house to yourself to fully stretch out after exploring downtown (1.5 mi), having a delicious meal and drink at the Cannery District (1 mi), or coming back from a game at MSU (1.5 mi).

If your canine friends are with you, they will have a blast in the large green space right out the backdoor and the quick access to the many trails and dog parks found in North Bozeman.

name: Creekside Cottage on Bozeman Creek
description: Cozy 2 bedroom cottage conveniently located in a beautiful private setting in the middle of town right next to Bozeman Creek.  Cottage has 2 master suites, each with its own bathroom.  Private deck and access to Bozeman creek which runs all year round.  Walking distance to Montana State University and about 1 mile from historic downtown Bozeman.  Parks as well as hiking and cross country ski trails are located nearby.  Downhill skiing and Yellowstone Park are within driving distance.
neighborhood_overview: Cottage is located within a neighborhood of single family homes and duplexes.  Park with a playground is located right across the street.   Local gas station and convenience store located in the neighborhood.  In addition, a coffee shop, dry cleaners, Rosa's Pizza and great Italian restaurant are just up the street.
host_about:
My family and I  feel  so fortunate to be living in an area of the country that many people desire to visit. As an Airbnb host we hope that our cottage and hospitatlity are as impressive as the scenery surrounding our beautiful city. We want your trip to Bozeman to be all that it can be and we know that it all starts with a memorable lodging experience. 
If you are thinking about moving to Monatana I would feel privlaged to help you find that perfect property to call home. I am a License Realtor in the State of Montana and I would love to send you listings prior to your visit. 
My family and I look forward to your visit and until then take care and stay healthy.

name: 4 blocks to MSU or Main St. Cozy & modernized.
description:
Clean, comfortable, modernized historic home. In the Cooper Park neighborhood, near MSU. Blocks from the local Co-op grocery store, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, downtown. Easy 4 block walk to main or MSU. 10-15 minute walk downtown. 25 minute drive to Bridger, 1 hr to Big Sky, 1.5 hrs to Yellowstone.

Bozeman is a mountain town; it’s eclectic with rural feels. Enjoy the local culture of historic and quirky homes near MSU.
neighborhood_overview: Our college neighborhood of Cooper Park is accessible to it all! Walk to the college or downtown, or jog over to Peet's Hill. The food co-op is nearby, as are several restaurants. If you're comfortable with short walks or public transit, no need to rent a car or request a lyft. If you want to stay off your feet, you can get to most areas in 5-10 minutes via car.
host_about:
I most often travel with my husband- we both work remotely so we are all around the US all the time. 

I am kind, communicative, and care about staying in non-touristy areas. 

Neither my husband nor I smoke, and we are careful to leave our Airbnbs as they were when we found them.

name: Comfortable and Modern Bozeman Abode
description: Situated on quiet street in the heart of Bozeman, minutes from downtown, with many options for dining, entertainment & shopping. This lovely place is a great home base!  Go enjoy the surrounding mountains and rivers, experience the Montana life style! Montana summers are fabulous & there are great day trip hikes in every direction. Montana winters are perfect for curling up with a good book … or go play in the snow!  SORRY NO PETS.  Sadly We had to change our policy due to damage.
neighborhood_overview: This house is a 30 minute walk from the central old town area.  There are coffee shops within five minutes walk -Cold Smoke Coffee house - Starbucks etc.  Grocery shopping is also nearby.  Kirk Park is a beautiful park that is two blocks away.
host_about:
Hello fellow travelers!  My husband and I love to travel and we love to stay in Airbnb’s.  
We realized that this is the best way to stay so in 2018 we set up a home in Phoenix  (where we live) so that our kids and our grandkids could have a place to stay when they come visit.  We also have a home in Montana, which is where I am from.  Much of my family still lives in Bozeman so we set up our home away from so we wouldn’t wear out our welcome when we come to visit!  Our Bozeman abode is beautiful and is located in the heart of the town.    We are very glad to be able to share our home away from home airbnb’s with you!

name: Aspen Brook - Immaculate home with mountain views.
description:
Aspen Brook is nestled in an Aspen and Spruce grove near Riverside Country Club. The club's tennis and pickle ball courts provide viewing entertainment off the rear deck, highlighted by the Bridger Range of the Rocky Mountains. A brook with a foot bridge flows between the deck and courts.

This unique offering features two master suites with large bathrooms and walk-ins, along with a third bedroom. The living room boasts a spectacular river rock gas fireplace and luxurious sectional.
neighborhood_overview: Aspen Brook is minutes away from downtown Bozeman, Belgrade, and the Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (BZN).  Bridger Bowl Ski Area is 16 miles away and Big Sky Ski Resort is just under an hour drive away.

name: BozemanAir - Montana Main House
description: Come stay in our brand new 2020 home just minutes from Montana State University. With room for the whole family, you'll enjoy the comforts of home and live like a Bozeman local. We are Montana natives and pride ourselves on offering you the best Airbnb experience possible. Reach out with any questions at all. We are super hosts and the property is family owned and operated. Need a car? Ask about our minivan on Turo. Let us show you our 5 star hospitality.
neighborhood_overview: Our space is part of the Southbridge Neighborhood in Bozeman right off 19th avenue and very close to Montana State University. It's quiet and very walkable. Lined by wheat fields and gorgeous mountain views from all directions. It's a family friendly neighborhood. We have 4 kiddos ourselves and it's perfect for evening strolls and bike rides yet about 15 minutes to down town.
host_about: Born and raised in Helena, Montana I spent the majority of my life in the big sky state before heading off to college. My sister and brother and their families all are in Bozeman and my parents too. Montana is family and we can't wait to welcome you into ours.

name: Downtown Creekside Hideaway - 30 Day Minimum
description:
Beautifully renovated 3 level 3Bd/3Ba + Office modern home minutes from Main Street.

Tucked into a quiet culdasac just 8 blocks south of charming Downtown Bozeman, you’ll feel like you are far from it all on 1/3 of an acre with direct access to the popular Gallagator trail. You can walk, run, bike or cross country ski on the miles of Bozeman city trails by crossing a private bridge in the backyard that spans a peaceful creek.

Thirty day minimum booking in window 1/1/23 - 3/31/23
host_about: We are both avid travelers and have lived, worked, studied and guided others through Latin America. We met doing what we love, backpacking in the mountains of southern Patagonia, and now make our permanent home base in Bozeman, Montana. We maintain deep connections to the Dominican Republic. Our twin daughters are 10 and love animals , so always vote to stay where there might be horses, goats, dogs and cats to meet.

description: Vintage House offers a high-end rental experience for groups in Beautiful Downtown Bozeman. You will have access to both units that are specially furnished, luxurious, and include all the necessary needs for a rejuvenating and sophisticated stay. 1 block to beautiful Main Street, you will be close to all the superb eateries, fantastic shopping, art galleries, and bustling nightlife that Bozeman has to offer. You'll be close to hiking, skiing, and plenty of other outdoor activities! - STR23-00095
neighborhood_overview: One block from Historic Main Street, Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even

name: Trailer Glamping of Story Hills
description: Welcome to the Trailer Glamper of Story Hills.  The best feature of our 33 ft trailer is the location.  Our property is 3 acres of mountain views and one mile from downtown.  It’s a short walk to local coffee shops, breweries, etc. Access Bozeman's trail system from our gate; Bridger Bowl  is 20 minutes away and MSU is 15 minutes by bike. We have the best of all worlds, a country feel, the amenities of a city, and easy access to wilderness adventures.
neighborhood_overview: We live in the ecclectic and unique Northeast side of Bozeman.  Its not trendy but is well known for the Wild Crumb Bakery, Mountains Walking Brewery, Fink's Deli and other local food trucks. The Story Mill Community Park is just outside our back gate and links you to an amazing trail system that takes you to the Bridger Mountains. Beautiful, historic, downtown Bozeman is one walkable mile away.
host_about: We have lived in Bozeman since 1991; married in 1998; and have owned this property since 2002. This is the place our three kids call home with space enough to ride horses, build snow forts and ski jumps, have huge backyard BBQ's and bonfires. Troy comes from an entrepreneurial background including the fitness business, film industry, insurance, and communication coaching. Lei-Anna has been in public education and currently consults with and travels to school districts around the country. We have a deep love and respect for the wilderness that surrounds us, the Greater Yellowstone, in addition to exercise, meditation, and a belief in a healthy organic and sustainable lifestyle.

name: Smack Dab in the Middle of Bozeman!
description:
Here in the Heart of Bozeman life can be whatever you want: quiet and simple or exciting and adventurous--all in the same day!
Whether you're on vacation or working in the valley, we've outfitted our home to be YOUR home while you're here. We are excited to welcome you to Bozeman, and to invite you to enjoy all this beautiful area has to offer!
neighborhood_overview:
The Walton Homestead subdivision is a quiet and inviting neighborhood with a family-friendly atmosphere and views of the Bridger Mountains. The yard and an open space behind the house gives kids and four-legged friends a place to stretch their legs and there's a full park and playground less than one block away. (Note: the yard is NOT fenced.)
Being at almost the exact geographic center of Bozeman, you'll be minutes away from everything: shopping, groceries, fine dining, fast food, the Gallatin Valley Mall, gyms, hiking (at multiple regional parks within city limits,) coffee shops, bars, cinemas, live theater, music venues, spas and salons, bowling, the Bozeman Swim Center, the Bozeman Beach, churches, not to mention the real reason so many people want to visit Bozeman--the skiing, fishing, golfing, hiking, camping, climbing and dozens of other outdoor activities the people of this town love so much!

host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact. I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

name: Western Magic - 3 Bedroom + Office Bozeman Condo
description: Western Magic is a spacious condo with 3 bedrooms, a fully equipped remote office with standup desk, supplies, & printer, and a fully stocked kitchen - to make the most of your Bozeman getaway. Enjoy a covered front patio for entertaining and relaxing, and a back patio for grilling with a large gas grill.  Located on the west edge of Bozeman, with views of the Bridgers and easy access to Big Sky or Bridger Bowl skiing, fly fishing, trails, downtown, and major stores. Family-friendly. No pets.
neighborhood_overview: This is a suburban neighborhood on the west side of Bozeman, with plenty of green space and walking trails close by that you can walk to from the condo. There is a lovely park a block away with a kids play area, and 4 blocks away is a set of walking/biking trails around 2 small "lakes", a larger kids play area and a picnic pavilion. Look out for Osprey dive bombing for fish in these lakes! Yes, you can fish in them. The neighborhood is a mix of families, students, and professionals. Be sure to drive slowly on the streets and be alert as there are joyful young kids who play outside in the neighborhood.
host_about:
Adventure mom, strategic marketer, sustainability & geotourism advocate.  I have 2 homes I rent when I am not in them, in Western North Carolina and in Bozeman, Montana. I know the WNC area around Bryson City, Nantahala Gorge, Sylva, Cherokee and across the park into Gatlinburg very well.  I also know the Bozeman and Greater Yellowstone Valley quite well after more than a decade of living there. I am a keen skier - alpine, telemark, xc classic and xc skate  as well as a fly fisherwoman, hiker, and biker. I love to help others find the right adventure activities, and places to go and see, for your vacation success.  

Hiking, float trips, white water rafting, lake paddling, waterfalls, mountain biking trails, best roads for road biking, best motorcycle touring roads, best skiing and rivers to fish are all things I'd love to help you find! Am very kid-centric, so am happy to be a great resource for the best things to do with kids from tiny tots to adventure loving teens.  I run an adventure tourism and travel marketing agency, so helping others find big and small adventures in cool places is in my DNA.

name: Access Friendly Location. Airport, MSU & Trails
description:
Bring the whole family (plus pet) for your basecamp in Bozeman. Ideally located near MSU, Yellowstone National Park and the airport for your work commute.

This spacious property offers an abundance of space for spreading your luggage out in each bedroom (3). A full kitchen is provided with use of pots, pans, Ninja blender, cast iron pans and more. High speed internet is included along with free parking.

This is a non-smoking household. Please enjoy at a near park and not in or at the house.
host_about: Avid outdoor enthusiast making the most out of exploring Montana and opening my doors to help you do the same! As a Bozeman resident for just over 3 years, originally hailing from the Great Lakes state of Michigan, I'm driven to put many miles in by foot, bike, skis and water ways. The state boasts incredible recreational opportunities with two spectacular National Parks and countless National Forests. Reach out as I'm always happy to recommend lovely meandering trails or delicious food around the area.

name: New!  Wonderful location! The Amble on Inn.
description: Montana has so much to offer year round. The Big sky is breathtaking.  Hiking, white water rafting, fishing, and breathing in all that mountain air.  Our well appointed condo is centrally located in Midtown Bozeman. Right off Main Street and North 7th Ave.  Clean and uncluttered, There is an in suite washer and dryer.  The kitchen is well equipped for cooking.  Easy access to eateries, groceries,  all with an old town Main street,  which is a wonderful place to walk.   All on grade level.
neighborhood_overview: You are a block and half off main street and one Block to the west of North 7th Ave. on a quiet street.  Up the street is the Elm event center,  Wilson auditorium, Micro breweries, coffee shops, grocery stores.  Many wonderful convinces and eateries very close. Walking our Main Street is always a pleasure.
host_about: A little about myself,  I spent 20 years as a designer and three years as an Art Educator for k-12.    For recreation, I love to cycle.  I feel like flying when I am on a bike.  Something about the wind in my face, the aroma of the surroundings, and the sweat on my brow. I love the view when cycling down the open road.  I love visiting new vacation homes, it is wonderful to see what each host offers.  I decided to set up an airbnb to host travelers coming to my area.  I grew up in The Gallatin Valley on the river and Graduated from Montana State University.    "Living life with creative zeal".  Laura Jean

name: The Downtown Bozeman Guest House
description: Welcome to your home in downtown Bozeman! This 3-bedroom, 1,500 sq. foot house has been our home for 16 years and we are excited to now share it with guests and visitors to Bozeman. Please note that there are tenants who live above the unit.

name: Bozeman's Main Stay the heart of downtown Bozeman
description: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. We are in the center of Bozeman with  it's wonderful restaurants and amazing downtown. The Bozeman's Main Stay is a historic home built in 1908 and one of a handful of homes still on Main St  We are just a short drive from Bridger Bowl and Big Sky ski resorts, as well as Yellowstone National Park and the world renowned Gallatin river.  Also minutes from the Yellowstone International airport, please come and enjoy.
neighborhood_overview:
Bozeman's main stay is located right on Main Street of Bozeman. We are so very close (just a block or two ) to the downtown area and its many wonderful restaurants and shops. We are also 1 block from The Wilson auditorium Which brings in the Bozeman Symphony and wonderful performances During the holidays.
We look forward to you staying with us.
host_about: I was born and raised in Bozeman I love this community and all that it has to give.  I enjoy all types of outdoors activities with my husband and son we love skiing, Boating and riding horses you name it we love to do it.

name: The Sweet Spot-Downtown Luxury *Walk Everywhere!*
description:
The Sweet Spot , located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors, truly the SWEET SPOT. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. Enjoy this newly built duplex, with contemporary and stylish amenities. Welcome to Bozeman, "the most livable town."
STR23-00052
neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities. Enjoy the being minutes away from the top fly fishing in the United States, ski hills, hiking trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
30 min or less to the Gallatin, Yellowstone and Madison Rivers.
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

name: (New Build) Townhome 10mins from Downtown
description:
Enjoy a centrally-located, newly-built townhome in the heart of Bozeman. The house is in a very safe area of the city, with friendly neighbors all around, and a beautiful view of the Bridger mountains. Across the street from the house is a large plot of farm land, which makes for amazing sunset viewing from the front porch.

When we say "centrally located", we mean...

- 10mins from downtown
- 1.5hrs from Gardiner (Yellowstone North Entrance)
- 1hr from Big Sky
- 35mins from Bridger Bowl.
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful little neighborhood located on the north side of Bozeman, about 1 mile from the freeway. Our neighborhood is filled with friendly people, a beautiful green, well-maintained park with a playground for kids. The drive to downtown is less than 10 minutes! We are in a well-populated area, so Ubers are typically an option, depending on the time of day.

name: Spacious 3Bdm Gallatin Green Condo | Trail Access
description:
Experience the best of Southwest Montana! This stunning condo has been thoughtfully designed for ultimate comfort, convenience, and entertainment. It offers high-end finishes, lots of space, and stylish furnishings to ensure an exceptional stay. Conveniently located on a trail system, the condo has easy access to various parks and playgrounds and serves as the perfect home base for your adventures.

*Fireplace & Smart TV
*Wifi + dedicated workspace
*Full kitchen & laundry
*Fantastic views
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is located in a residential neighborhood in Northwest Bozeman, offering a serene retreat while being conveniently close to shopping areas. It serves as an ideal base camp for exploring the many recreational opportunities for which Bozeman is known. Downtown Bozeman and Montana State University are just an 11-minute drive away, Bridger Bowl is approximately 28 minutes away, and Big Sky Resort is an hour's drive from the condo.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Peaceful garden setting with 3 bedrooms
description: Enjoy easy access to popular shops and restaurants from this charming place to stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's something delicious available at most hours of the day.

name: Little Yellow House - Downtown Charming 2 BDRM
description: Welcome to our cheerful, warm and cozy "little yellow house" located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in the surrounding nature and parks--all within a 5-minute walk to central downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl ski area, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by Erin, an Airbnb Superhost, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival, Bungalow/craftsman, and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Modern 3Bdrm Stay | Mountain Views & Beach Access
description:
Welcome to Drishti House - a luxurious retreat nestled by the picturesque shoreline of Bozeman Beach. It features 3 spacious bedrooms, each with its own en-suite bathroom for ultimate comfort and privacy, and makes it the perfect getaway for friends, families, or groups. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Bridger Mountains throughout the home and easy access to a shared beach and nearby hiking and biking trails.

*Cozy fireplace
*Chef's kitchen
*Patios with seating
*3-story layout
*Laundry
neighborhood_overview:
The home is situated in the newly developed residential area of Bridger Vale on Bozeman's north side, offering stunning views and a peaceful ambiance. This area is home to Bozeman Beach, a popular summer destination bustling with swimmers, paddle-boarders, small watercraft, and beach volleyball enthusiasts. Just across the water or a short drive away, you can enjoy MAP Brewing and various other local amenities.

Get to downtown Bozeman in approximately 7 minutes by vehicle! Here you will find everything you need including grocery stores, pharmacies, shopping, dining, and more!

With easy access to I-90 and only 16 miles to Bridger Bowl, this is a perfect location for exploring all that Bozeman and the Gallatin Valley have to offer.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone Nationa
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Luxury Townhome w/Big Sky Views
description:
Beautifully appointed with all the comforts of home this experience will not disappoint. Situated on a 7- acre park with a private back yard & big Bridger Mountain views this home showcases what we love about Montana. High-end furnishings and finishes make this a perfect destination for the discriminating traveler. House is meticously maintained and cleaned between guests for peace of mind. Many extra amenities from robes to soaps & everything in between make it hard to say goodbye.
STR21-00035

host_about:

We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Downtown Charming & Cozy Casita - 3 BDRM
description: This downtown 3-Bedroom charming casita has a unique western-vintage style and is conveniently located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with leafy trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: Downtown Dream house
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located home. Lots of space both inside and out. Lovely yard with fire pit, a front porch with rockers, and a breeze way for easy dry access to the kitchen or a great place to grill and hang out. Walk to campus and town from this convenient location.

3 bedrooms, two up and one down, each with a queen bed, 2 full baths w/towels etc, kitchen, dining-room and livingroom have loads of windows. Stone fireplace adds extra charm.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

name: Bozeman Creek House
description: Fantastic house and yard, 3 blocks from Main Street and right on Bozeman Creek as well as at the end of the street. New property starting in 2023! High speed wifi. A/C
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Elegant 3Bdrm Stay | Mountain Views & Beach Access
description:
Pagoda Peaks is waiting to welcome you! This stunning 3-story home offers luxurious accommodations with breathtaking panoramic views of the Bridger Mountains. Perfect for families or couples, it features 3 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms, two fireplaces, and exquisite furnishings. The chef's kitchen, grand dining area, and multiple terraces provide ample space for relaxation and entertainment.

*Luxury amenities
*Outdoor seating & BBQ
*Laundry
*Private office
*Backs onto hiking/biking trail systems
neighborhood_overview:
The home is situated in a truly wonderful location. With breathtaking views of the Bridger Mountains and steps to Bozeman Beach, it offers the perfect blend of natural beauty and convenient access to outdoor activities, making it an ideal retreat for nature lovers, adventure seekers, and anyone wanting some rest and relaxation.

Pagoda Peaks is 2.5 miles from downtown Bozeman, 16 miles to Bridger Bowl Ski Area, 52 miles to Big Sky Resort, and 90 miles to Yellowstone National Park.

The area features endless hiking and mountain biking trails, blue-ribbon trout streams, and Nordic and Alpine Ski areas.

The popular MAP brewing company is just across the pond, and many restaurants and shops are nearby at the Cannery District and Downtown Bozeman.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry explori
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Bridger Hawk - Mid-Century Classic (NEW)
description: Discover Bozeman's charm from our mid-century 3BR, 2BA home! Minutes from downtown, with Bridger Mountain views, indulge in luxury with hotel-style amenities, a wood fireplace, and comfy beds. Enjoy a spacious backyard & garage—perfect for snowy days. Close to nature & city delights, it’s a haven for relaxation and adventure. Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or an exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for your MT journey.
neighborhood_overview:
Beyond the confines of this home away from home, Bozeman's cultural and natural treasures await. Find yourself just minutes from artisan boutiques, eclectic eateries, and buzzing nightlife downtown. Or answer the call of the wild as you venture into the mountain trails, picturesque hikes, and panoramic vistas of the Bridgers.

Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or a comprehensive exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for a journey steeped in comfort and style. The soul of the past meets the spirit of the present, right here, beneath the vast Montana skies. Welcome home!

STR23-00019
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

* Miles of hiking and biking trails directly out the back door
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled within a quaint development of 20 recently built luxury townhomes, our residence offers a prime location directly opposite Glen Rotary Lake. This picturesque lake provides a gateway to various recreational activities such as fishing, swimming, and kayaking. The surrounding area features a scenic walking path encircling the lake, leading conveniently to the MAP Brewing Company—a fantastic spot for dining, drinks, and live music. Step out the back door, and you'll discover an extensive network of hiking and biking trails that wind their way alongside the scenic East Gallatin River.

Within walking distance, you'll also find Gildhouse Suites, a venue that houses a delightful coffee shop and a comprehensive salon/spa experience.

The convenience continues with our home being just minutes away from downtown Bozeman, while a short 20-minute drive takes you to the slopes of Bridger Ski Resort. Enjoy the perfect blend of tranquility and accessibility at our locatio
host_about: Hello! Thank you for considering a stay at our home! We are an active family that loves to travel. We also love hosting fellow travelers! We are available for questions 8am-6pm MST or in case of emergency.

name: Spacious Family Home | Privacy, Backyard w/ Patio
description:
Have fun making memories in this nostalgic, family-friendly retreat! The spacious backyard with a patio and outdoor seating is perfect for family fun and relaxation. With 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, and ample space, you'll enjoy all the amenities for a convenient and comfortable stay.

*Full kitchen
*Two living rooms
*Highchair and Pack 'n Play
*Dedicated workspace
*Washer and dryer
*Beautiful location
neighborhood_overview:
The home is nestled in a charming, tree-lined residential area of Bozeman, offering a serene neighborhood atmosphere while being conveniently close to essential businesses and exciting attractions.

Bozeman is known as “the most livable place” for good reason. Enjoy world-renowned fly fishing, and stunning mountains for hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, hunting, and backcountry exploring. Yellowstone National Park and abundant wildlife are also nearby. Don’t miss out on Bozeman’s city experience - explore the vibrant arts and culture scene with main street festivals, farmers markets, cultural centers, museums, symphonies, theaters, and art galleries.

It’s less than a mile to Gallatin Valley Mall and Whole Foods and 2.7 miles to downtown Bozeman. Find cute coffee shops, great dining options, bars, cool boutiques, and much more in the vibrant downtown! The home is also 10 miles to the airport, 20 miles to Bridger Bowl, 47 miles to Big Sky Resort, and
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Fisherman’s Folly
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience, within a spacious centrally-located home.

Fully remodeled mid-century. Ten minute walk to main street with its restaurants, breweries, boutiques and galleries.

This is the owner’s principal residence so they’ve made it very warm and comfortable.

Double doors open to a patio and large backyard filled with plantings and whimsical touches. On the front side theres a lovely sitting area with a solo fire stove to enjoy.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

description: Experience a trip to Montana from this spacious 4-bedroom, 4-bath townhome with stunning mountain views. Walk to the waterfront at Glen Rotary Park, hit the slopes at Bridger Bowl Ski Area, or spend a day exploring Yellowstone National Park. FAMILY ATTRACTIONS: Bozeman Brewery Historic District (2 miles), Montana State University (3 miles), Museum of the Rockies (4 miles)

The Southbridge subdivision in Bozeman, Montana, offers a charming and picturesque setting for short-term rental homes, nestled within the stunning natural beauty of the Gallatin Valley. Bozeman itself is a vibrant and thriving city renowned for its unique blend of outdoor adventure, cultural attractions, and small-town charm.

Southbridge is ideally situated just a short distance from downtown Bozeman, providing guests with convenient access to a plethora of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The subdivision boasts well-maintained streets lined with beautiful homes, offering a tranquil retreat for visitors seeking relaxation and rejuvenation.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the abundance of outdoor recreational opportunities available in the surrounding area, including hiking, fishing, skiing, and more. It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

description:
Discover Bozeman from our central 3-bedroom retreat! Just blocks from Main St., parks, and so much more. Ideal for families, friends, or groups.

Normally we rent this apartment by the room but when you choose this listing you have the entire 3 bedroom basement apartment to yourself. Two queen sized beds and one full bed with a living room, dining room, full kitchen and bathroom.

Early check-in option, and leave the cleaning to us with our no-chore checkout!
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located within walking distance, you'll find Bogert and Lindley Parks, where all the summer festivals come to life. Additionally, Pete's Hill and its extensive network of over 80 miles of trails are easily accessible. Bozeman Public Library, downtown with its array of shops, bars, and restaurants, as well as public transport options to Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, are all just a short stroll away.

description: **SOFT OPENING:** Enjoy 50% off stays before 04/30/25 at this exquisitely restored 1881 Vintage Estate in Downtown Bozeman. Perfect for groups, this high-end offering consists of three luxurious, private residences with everything needed for a relaxing, sophisticated stay. Just a block from Main Street, you’ll be steps away from Bozeman’s top eateries, shopping, galleries, and vibrant nightlife.
neighborhood_overview:
A hot spot for investment and opportunity, Bozeman has attracted the nation’s eye. This idyllic town is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter the time of year. Located in the most exclusive location in Downtown Bozeman, VE is exclusivity and privacy in the center of the city. The property is in the central business district offering convenient access to restaurants, shops, and nightlife. Within six blocks of VE, you’ll find numerous eateries and boutique shops, right within walking distance. The area offers dining options like Little Star Diner, a farm-to-table restaurant just a block away, known for locally sourced dishes. A short walk further brings you to Main Street where Blackbird Kitchen serves up handcrafted pizzas and Italian-inspired cuisine. Outside of restaurants, you’ll also find a nearby French bakery and cafe, Vienne, and dessert options such as La Chatelaine Chocolat Co.

Beyond the cityscape, in the warmer months you
